questions.question: What is the primary cause of overfitting in machine learning models?

answers.b: Using too few parameters in the model
answers.c: Learning noise instead of general patterns

explanations.a: More data helps generalization but isn't the primary cause.
explanations.b: Too few parameters usually cause underfitting, not overfitting.
explanations.c: Correct! Overfitting happens when the model memorizes the noise instead of learning general patterns.
explanations.d: A simple model usually leads to underfitting, not overfitting.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common symptom of underfitting?

answers.a: High training accuracy but low test accuracy
answers.b: Low accuracy on both training and test data
answers.c: Model performing exceptionally well on unseen data
answers.d: A high number of parameters leading to complex decision boundaries

explanations.a: This is a sign of overfitting, not underfitting.
explanations.b: Correct! Underfitting happens when the model is too simple to capture patterns, leading to poor accuracy on both datasets.
explanations.c: A well-generalized model should perform well, but not exceptionally better than on training data.
explanations.d: A high number of parameters usually leads to overfitting.

questions.question: Why is a train/test split necessary in machine learning?

answers.a: To make the model memorize the test data
answers.b: To evaluate the model's performance on unseen data
answers.c: To prevent the model from learning any patterns

explanations.a: Memorizing test data leads to overfitting, which we want to avoid.
explanations.b: Correct! A train/test split helps assess the model's generalization ability.
explanations.c: The goal is to learn patterns, but avoid memorization.
explanations.d: A train/test split is for evaluation, not improving training accuracy.

questions.question: What is the primary difference between supervised and unsupervised learning?

answers.a: Supervised learning requires labeled data, while unsupervised learning does not
answers.b: Unsupervised learning uses neural networks, while supervised learning does not
answers.c: Supervised learning is only used for regression tasks
answers.d: Unsupervised learning always provides better accuracy

explanations.a: Correct! Supervised learning works with labeled data, while unsupervised learning identifies patterns without labels.
explanations.b: Both learning types can use neural networks.
explanations.c: Supervised learning is used for both classification and regression.
explanations.d: Accuracy depends on the problem; one is not always better than the other.
